titleStmt.title: A Poetical Question concerning the Jacobites, sent to the Athenians.
titleStmt.author: Elizabeth Rowe (née Singer)

bibl.title: A Poetical Question concerning the Jacobites, sent to the Athenians.
bibl.author: Elizabeth Rowe (née Singer)

front.head: A Poetical Question concerning the Jacobites, sent to the Athenians.

lg.l: So I resolv't' employ my Loyal Quill.
What more glorious can exact my Lays
A Name my Lines grow proud to bear!
A Prince as Great, and wondrous Good, as e're
The sacred Burden of a Crown did wear.
Resolve me, then, what are those,
(Can there be any such?) You call his Foes?
His Foes, Curst word, and why they'd pierce his breast,
Ungrateful Vipers! where they warmly rest?
